data.chText: 精神压力
data.enText: mental pressure

data.chText: 精神压力；心理负担；紧张
data.enText: pressure or worry caused by the problems in sb's life

data.chText: 人在压力之下，办事情就容易出差错。
data.enText: Things can easily go wrong when people are under stress .

data.chText: 有精神压力
data.enText: to suffer from stress

data.chText: 应对压力
data.enText: coping with stress

data.chText: 她承受不了作为一个公众人物的生活压力和紧张。
data.enText: She failed to withstand the stresses and strains of public life.

data.chText: 与精神压力有关的疾病
data.enText: stress-related illnesses

data.chText: 感情 / 思想负担
data.enText: emotional/mental stress

data.chText: 心理压力常常是形成长期病的一个因素。
data.enText: Stress is often a factor in the development of long-term sickness.

data.chText: 对于压力的应对
data.enText: stress management (= dealing with stress)

data.chText: 物理压力
data.enText: physical pressure

data.chText: 压力；应力
data.enText: pressure put on sth that can damage it or make it lose its shape

data.chText: 一旦受伤，你便会让身体其他部位受力。
data.enText: When you have an injury you start putting stress on other parts of your body.

data.chText: 足部应力性骨折
data.enText: a stress fracture of the foot (= one caused by such pressure)

data.chText: 强调
data.enText: emphasis

data.chText: 强调；重要性
data.enText: special importance given to sth

data.chText: 她十分注重守时。
data.enText: She lays great stress on punctuality.

data.chText: 我认为公司对成本强调有余，而对质量重视不足。
data.enText: I think the company places too much stress on cost and not enough on quality.

data.chText: 单词；音节
data.enText: on word/syllable

data.chText: 重音；重读
data.enText: an extra force used when pronouncing a particular word or syllable

data.chText: 我们学习了语音、重读和语调。
data.enText: We worked on pronunciation, stress and intonation.

data.chText: 主 / 次重音
data.enText: primary/secondary stress

data.chText: strategic一词的重音在第二音节。
data.enText: In ‘strategic’ the stress falls on the second syllable.

data.chText: 音乐
data.enText: in music

data.chText: 加强（音）
data.enText: extra force used when making a particular sound in music

data.chText: 疾病
data.enText: illness

data.chText: 环境恶劣引起的疾病
data.enText: illness caused by difficult physical conditions

data.chText: 上了年纪的人最容易因受热而生病。
data.enText: Those most vulnerable to heat stress are the elderly.

data.chText: 强调
data.enText: emphasize

data.chText: 强调；着重
data.enText: to emphasize a fact, an idea, etc.

data.chText: 他强调了接受良好教育的重要性。
data.enText: He stressed the importance of a good education.

data.chText: 我必须强调，我告诉你的一切都要严加保密。
data.enText: I must stress that everything I've told you is strictly confidential.

data.chText: 约翰逊强调说：“别无真正能够替代的办法。”
data.enText: ‘There is,’ Johnson stressed, ‘no real alternative.’

data.chText: 必须着重指出，这种病非常罕见。
data.enText: It must be stressed that this disease is very rare.

data.chText: 单词；音节
data.enText: word/syllable

data.chText: 重读；用重音读
data.enText: to give extra force to a word or syllable when saying it

data.chText: happiness一词重读第一个音节。
data.enText: You stress the first syllable in ‘happiness’.

data.chText: （使）焦虑不安，疲惫不堪
data.enText: to become or make sb become too anxious or tired to be able to relax

data.chText: 出问题时，我尽量不紧张。
data.enText: I try not to stress out when things go wrong.

data.chText: 在城市里开车让我真的很紧张。
data.enText: Driving in cities really stresses me (out).

data.chText: 以上各词均指生活上的心理压力、精神紧张。
data.enText: These are all words for the feelings of anxiety caused by the problems in sb's life.
pressure

data.chText: 指为达到某一目标或有某种行为表现而产生的心理压力、紧张：
data.enText: difficulties and feelings of anxiety that are caused by the need to achieve sth or to behave in a particular way

data.chText: 由于工作紧张她不能出席。
data.enText: She was unable to attend because of the pressures of work.
stress

data.chText: 指因生活问题引起的精神压力、心理负担、紧张：
data.enText: pressure or anxiety caused by the problems in sb's life

data.chText: 与精神压力有关的疾病
data.enText: stress-related illnesses

data.chText: 用pressure还是stress？
承受精神压力常用suffer from stress，而pressure可指造成压力（stress）的事物。
data.enText: It is common to say that sb is suffering from stress , while pressure may be the thing that causes stress .
pressure or stress?
tension

data.chText: 指情绪上的紧张、烦躁：
data.enText: a feeling of anxiety and stress that makes it impossible to relax

data.chText: 神经紧张
data.enText: nervous tension
strain

data.chText: 指压力、重负、重压之下出现的问题、担忧：
data.enText: pressure on sb/sth because they have too much to do or manage; the problems, worry or anxiety that this produces

data.chText: 我觉得照料四个孩子挺累的。
data.enText: I found it a strain looking after four children.
to cause stress/tension/strain
cope with/deal with/handle the pressure/stress/tension/strain
to relieve/ease the pressure/stress/tension/strain
to be suffering from stress/tension
to be under pressure/stress/strain
considerable pressure/stress/tension/strain

data.chText: 以上两词均含（音节、单词、短语中的）重读之义。
data.enText: These words both mean to give extra force to a syllable, word or phrase when you are saying it.
stress

data.chText: 指重读、用重音读（单词或音节）：
data.enText: to give extra force to a word or syllable when saying it

data.chText: happiness一词重读第一个音节。
data.enText: You stress the first syllable in ‘happiness’.
emphasize

data.chText: 指重读、强调（词或短语）、加强语气：
data.enText: to give extra force to a word or phrase when saying it, especially to show that it is important

data.chText: “别让任何事物…任何事物，”他强调任何这个词道，“来引诱你。”
data.enText: ‘Let nothing … nothing,’ he emphasized the word, ‘tempt you.’

ex.chText: 道德问题是他讲话的重点。
ex.enText: Morality was the emphasis of his speech.

ex.chText: 这本书特别强调了空气污染问题。
ex.enText: This book places a special emphasis on air pollution.

synonyms.bx: 指尽力突出的重点或重要性。

ex.chText: 他发表了讲话，重点在教育方面。
ex.enText: He gave a speech with the accent on education.

ex.chText: 该公司把重点放在新信息技术上面。
ex.enText: The company put the accent on new information technology.

ex.chText: 他强调诚实是一种重要的美德。
ex.enText: He lays stress/emphasis on honesty as an important virtue.

ex.chText: 我们现在的工作重点应该放在农业上。
ex.enText: The stress/emphasis of our work should now be on agriculture.

synonyms.bx: 可与 emphasis 换用，侧重指对某一观念、事实、活动等给予的特别关注或重视。

ex.chText: 你可以通过做运动来减压。
ex.enText: You can do some exercises to relieve tension.

ex.chText: 这次会谈大大缓和了紧张局面。
ex.enText: The talk lessened the tension greatly.

ex.chText: 学生和教职员工之间的关系逐渐紧张起来。
ex.enText: Tension developed between the students and faculty.

ex.chText: 头痛可能是由颈部肌肉紧张导致的。
ex.enText: Headaches may be caused by tension in the neck muscles.

synonyms.bx: 主要指精神、心理上的紧张，也指人与人或国与国之间的紧张关系，或某物被过度拉伸的程度或状态。

ex.chText: 这轮胎太硬，要减少一点压力。
ex.enText: The tyre is too hard; reduce the pressure a bit.

ex.chText: 她的身体被工作压力压垮了。
ex.enText: Her health collapsed under the pressure of work.

ex.chText: 我们应对他施加更大的压力。
ex.enText: We must bring more pressure to bear on him.

ex.chText: 她能妥善应付生活压力。
ex.enText: She was able to cope well with the pressures of life.

synonyms.bx: 多指由气体或液体产生的压力，或某事物所产生的压力或影响力，包括工作或生活中的压力。

ex.chText: 这根柱子承受了整个结构的压力。
ex.enText: This post takes the strain of the whole structure.

ex.chText: 她现在心情紧张，因为她的小孩病了。
ex.enText: She's under a lot of strain at the moment because her child's ill.

ex.chText: 工作量过大使雇员产生很严重的焦虑情绪。
ex.enText: Too much work put a severe strain on employees.

synonyms.bx: 指物体所承受的张力或拉力，也指因外界压力而造成的身心和情绪等方面的焦虑或压抑。

ex.chText: 高跟鞋会对脚踝产生很大的压力。
ex.enText: Shoes with high heels put great stress on ankles.

ex.chText: 苏珊被考试的压力压垮了。
ex.enText: Susan was completely weighed down by the stress of examinations.

ex.chText: 新工作的压力使他患上了胃溃疡。
ex.enText: The stress from the new job caused him to suffer from gastric ulcers.

synonyms.bx: 指施加于物体、能使其损坏或变形的压力或应力；也指精神压力或心理负担，侧重于一种长期的忧虑。

tr: the relative prominence of a syllable or musical note (especially with regard to stress or pitch)
example: he put the stress on the wrong syllable

tr: (physics) force that produces strain on a physical body
example: the intensity of stress is expressed in units of force divided by units of area

tr: (psychology) a state of mental or emotional strain or suspense
example: he suffered from fatigue and emotional tension

tr: difficulty that causes worry or emotional tension
example: she endured the stresses and strains of life
he presided over the economy during the period of the greatest stress and danger"- R.J.Samuelso
the stress was more on accuracy than on speed
In Farsi, you accent the last syllable of each word

tr: to stress, single out as important
example: Dr. Jones emphasizes exercise in addition to a change in diet

value.def: If you stress a point in a discussion, you put extra emphasis on it because you think it is important.

example.ex: The spokesman stressed that the measures did not amount to an overall ban...
example.tran: 该发言人强调这些措施并不等同于全面禁止。

example.ex: They also stress the need for improved employment opportunities, better transport and health care...
example.tran: 他们同时也强调需要增加就业机会，改善交通和医疗保健服务。

example.ex: 'We're not saying we're outside and above all this,' he stresses.
example.tran: “我们并不是说我们对此不闻不问，”他强调道。

example.ex: Japanese car makers are laying ever more stress on European sales.
example.tran: 日本汽车制造商比以往任何时候都更加重视欧洲市场的销售情况。

value.def: If you feel under stress, you feel worried and tense because of difficulties in your life.

example.ex: Katy could think clearly when not under stress...
example.tran: 在没有精神压力的情况下凯蒂思路清晰。

example.ex: Of course, the British will suffer such daily stresses patiently.
example.tran: 当然，英国人将会耐心地承受这些日常压力。
与精神压力有关的一系列问题

value.tran: 精神压力;心理负担;紧张

value.def: Stresses are strong physical pressures applied to an object.

example.ex: Earthquakes happen when stresses in rock are suddenly released as the rocks fracture.
example.tran: 当岩石碎裂时其承受的压力突然释放出来，地震就发生了。

value.def: If you stress a word or part of a word when you say it, you put emphasis on it so that it sounds slightly louder.

example.ex: 'Sit down,' she replied, stressing each word.
...the misplaced stress on the first syllable of this last word.
example.tran: 最后这一个单词第一个音节不应重读

trans: 应力分布；力分布；应力分布图；应力分散
残余应力；残留应力；殘留應力；剩余应力；焊接残余应力
剪切应力；剪应力；切应力；剪應力；剪切力
应力分析；压力分析；有限元分析模块；受力分析；应力
热应力；熱應力；温度应力；应力；热冲击
应力腐蚀；應力腐蝕；应力腐蚀开裂或应力腐蚀；应力腐化；应力侵蚀
拉应力；拉伸应力；张应力；抗拉强度；拉伸强度
应力强度；应力密度；应力；采用应力强度；应力强度法
构造应力；应力；大地应力
温度应力；温度胁迫；温度逆境；气温胁迫；温差应力
